title: General
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Spondee--Spondee--Spondee--Sponde--Dactyl--Spondee

  • The line must be completely correct in its scansion. Copying of the Latin need not be perfect. The final foot may be rendered as a spondee, as long-short, as X, or as long-anceps.

  • The student may put long and short marks over the Latin syllables or write out the names of each metrical unit as above.

  • If the student offers both styles of scansion and they do not match up, then the long and short marks take precedence over the writing out of the words "dactyl" and "spondee".

  • The student does not have to mark the elision in the second foot to get credit.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point maximum

  • The line must be completely correct in its scansion. Copying of the Latin need not be perfect. The final foot may be rendered as a spondee, as long-short, as X, or as long-anceps.

  • The student may put long and short marks over the Latin syllables or write out the names of each metrical unit as above.

  • If the student offers both styles of scansion and they do not match up, then the long and short marks take precedence over the writing out of the words "dactyl" and "spondee".

  • The student does not have to mark the elision in the second foot to get credit.

Student response earns one of the available points.

1 point maximum

  • The line must be completely correct in its scansion. Copying of the Latin need not be perfect. The final foot may be rendered as a spondee, as long-short, as X, or as long-anceps.

  • The student may put long and short marks over the Latin syllables or write out the names of each metrical unit as above.

  • If the student offers both styles of scansion and they do not match up, then the long and short marks take precedence over the writing out of the words "dactyl" and "spondee".

  • The student does not have to mark the elision in the second foot to get credit.
